intro: Lippia baumii, commonly known as dwarf silverleaf, is a perennial shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-green leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping and coastal gardens. Its essential oils, derived from the leaves, are used in aromatherapy and natural insect repellents. Lippia baumii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract beneficial pollinators.
